column4: I cannot orient myself in '.config - Linux Kernel v2.6.24.3 Configuration' Where would I find there the line CONFIG_VT_CONSOLE=y?
just search for it?
What do you mean by "just search"?
well, in most apps you can search inside a file for stuff
just open the file in a texteditor that can, if this is a textfile which I assume
Excellent! I am speaking about a program and not a file.
okay, then what program? or is the program called ".config"
or am I tlaking to the wrong person here? (goes checking)
The program's name is '.config - Linux Kernel v2.6.24.3 Configuration'. I have clearly stated that in my question at the outset.
hehe, you don't expect me to know the name of every program ever written, do you? To me that seems like the .config file for a kernel. Anyhows, good luck ;)
Enjoy Ubuntu!
yeah.. That I am.
are you in th dir of the .confg?
Just a moment. Checking ...
else as I said, open the .config in a texteditor such as gedit or vim, there you can search for that line
have you installed the sources?
I have installed the DEB program packages 'linux-source' and 'linux-source-2.6.24'.
I don't really know what you are trying to do, so maybe I should stop helping you :)
for that command to work, you need to be in the folder where your .config file is
the terminal?
what do you mean by the console?
what exactly are you doing dude?
